strategies: Honor thy error as a hidden intention
Remove specifics and convert to ambiguities
Only one element of each kind
What would your closest friend do?
What to increase? What to reduce?
Look closely at the most embarrassing details and amplify them
Make a sudden, destructive unpredictable action; incorporate
Do nothing for as long as possible
Discover the recipes you are using and abandon them
Don't be afraid of things because they're easy to do
Don't be frightened to display your talents
What mistakes did you make last time?
How would you have done it?
State the problem in words as clearly as possible
Assemble some of the instruments in a group and treat the group
Balance the consistency principle with the inconsistency principle
Convert a melodic element into a rhythmic element
Define an area as 'safe' and use it as an anchor
Destroy nothing; Destroy the most important thing
Discover your formulas and abandon them
Don't stress one thing more than another
Give way to your worst impulse
Go slowly all the way round the outside
Go to an extreme, move back to a more comfortable place
How would someone else do it?
How would you explain this to your parents?
Imagine the problem is solved. How did you solve it?
Instead of changing the thing, change the world around it
Left channel, right channel, center channel
List the qualities it has. List those you'd like
Listen in total darkness, or in a very large room, very quietly
Look at a very small object, look at its center
Look at the order in which you do things
Make a blank valuable by putting it in an exquisite frame
Make an exhaustive list of everything you might do and do the last thing on the list
Repetition is a form of change
The most important thing is the thing most easily forgotten
Think - inside the work - outside the work
Use a technique from a different discipline
What are you really thinking about just now?
What mistakes did you make last time?
What would your closest friend do?
You can only make one dot at a time
Your mistake was a hidden intention
scamperStrategies: Combine: What can you combine or bring together somehow?
Adapt: What can you adapt for use as a solution?
Modify: What can you modify or magnify?
Put to other uses: How can you put the thing to different or better use?
Reverse: What elements can you reverse or arrange in a different order?
Substitute: Change materials, processes, location, etc.
Combine: Combine parts, ideas, or aspects that were not connected before
Adapt: What else is like this? What other idea does this suggest?
Modify: Change the meaning, shape, color, sound, motion, or quality
Magnify: What can you magnify, enlarge, or extend?
Minify: What can you make smaller, lighter, or slower?
Put to other uses: What else can this be used for?
Eliminate: What can you simplify? What's not needed?
Reverse: What would happen if you reversed the process?
Rearrange: What other arrangement might be better?
creativeConstraints: Work with only 3 elements
Force a new perspective by 10x magnification
Finish within the next five minutes
Remove the central component
Make it possible for a child to understand
Express the solution without using industry terms
Describe your solution in exactly 50 words
Remove all metaphors from your thinking
Use only metaphors in your thinking
What if the opposite were true?
How would nature solve this problem?
Explain your solution using only drawings
Start from the end and work backward
Assume unlimited resources
Assume extremely limited resources
Make it work offline
Make it work for someone with a disability
What's the simplest possible version?
How would you solve this in the 1800s?
How would you solve this in the year 2200?
What if you had to deliver this tomorrow?
What if you had a year to perfect it?
How would a 5-year-old approach this?
How would your hero approach this?
